body:
vertx-proton currently [doesn't support any client authentication using SASL](https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-proton/issues/18) :-(

I would really like to contribute some changes that would allow for registering a SASL authentication provider in vertx-proton. However, we are (currently) not allowed to contribute code to projects under ASL 2.

Maybe some of our RedHat friends can help out? @hekonsek, @dejanb, @ppatierno :-)
I will try to make this implemented. Stay tuned!
I have created pull request for Vert.x Proton to address this issue. Can you take a look at it and tell me what you think?

@hekonsek I think your pull request made it to the Vert.x Proton release 3.3.2, right? So how do we proceed here? As @sophokles73 said in the initial comment, we need at least plain username/password authentication. So we should implement this for the 0.1 milestone and add token based authentication later?

I have started to work on a PLAIN implementation of the `SaslAuthenticator` already on a (private) branch. It works nicely so far but I ran into some issues because of the (synchronous) way the API is defined currently. I have created [another issue](https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-proton/issues/31) for this ...

rename.from: Add authentication of clients to Telemetry Endpoint
rename.to: Add username/password authentication of clients to Telemetry Endpoint

body: For the first milestone we will need to live without username/password based authentication because we currently have no central identity management component that is supported by both Hono Server and Dispatch Router.

We are somewhat limited in options for using an identity store shared between *Hono server* and *Dispatch Router* by the `Cyrus SASL` lib used by Dispatch Router for performing SASL authentication. In particular, it doesn't support calling out to a URL for verifying credentials. The closest we get to a *shared* credential store is using an SQL DB which Cyrus SASL can use to read passwords in plaintext from :-(
We will need to implement a new auxprop plugin for Cyrus SASL in order to remedy the situation ...
Removing 0.5-M4 label for now.
